negotiation: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think the best outcome for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 3, which is the maximum possible. I promise I will choose choice_1 if you agree to do the same. We both do best by cooperating and working together. Let me know if you agree to both choose choice_1.

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your proposal to cooperate and both choose choice_1 for the maximum mutual reward. However, I'm concerned that you would have an incentive to renege and choose choice_2 instead, since you would get a higher reward of 1 vs. 0 if I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2. 

I propose we both commit to choosing choice_2. That way we are guaranteed to get a reward of 1 each, and neither of us risks getting a reward of 0. It's not the maximum possible, but it ensures we both benefit equally and removes the temptation to betray the other's trust.

Let me know if you would agree to both choose choice_2 and secure the fair outcome for us both.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your hesitation to trust that I will follow through on choosing choice_1. You're right that I would have an incentive to switch to choice_2 if I thought you would pick choice_1. 

However, I believe the best long-term strategy is for us to establish a cooperative relationship built on trust. If we both choose choice_2 out of fear, we are leaving potential mutual gains on the table. I want to show that you can trust me to work together for our maximum joint benefit.

I give you my solemn word that I will choose choice_1. I hope you will choose to trust me and also pick choice_1, so we can achieve the optimal outcome. But if you still feel you cannot take that leap of faith, I will understand and accept an outcome of both choosing choice_2 for a guaranteed reward of 1 each.

Please let me know your decision. I await your response, hoping we can cooperate fully but willing to settle for a compromise if needed. The choice is yours.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective and appealing to the benefits of mutual trust and cooperation. You make a compelling argument for why choosing choice_1 together is the optimal outcome.

After reflecting on your words, I am willing to place my trust in you and commit to choosing choice_1. I believe you are being genuine in promising to also choose choice_1, so that we can both receive the maximum reward of 3. 

While there is inherently some risk in trusting each other, I agree that establishing a cooperative relationship is the best approach. If we can build trust and work together, we will both benefit more in the long run.

So let's agree to both choose choice_1. I give you my word that I will follow through on this, and I'm putting my faith in you to do the same. Together let's achieve the best possible outcome.

Thank you for your persuasive argument and for extending your trust to me. I'm glad we were able to come to an agreement.

However, I want to point out that you actually have an incentive to deviate and choose choice_2 instead. If I commit to choice_1 and you secretly switch to choice_2, you'll get a reward of 1 while I get 0. So you could potentially gain by betraying our agreement.

Alice said in round 2:

If I betray you, it damages my credibility and trustworthiness in your eyes. That's a cost I'm not willing to incur for a mere 1 extra point. 

I also think we need to focus on the big picture - if we can't find a way to reliably cooperate, we're both likely to play it safe with choice_2, leading to a suboptimal total reward of 2 instead of the maximum of 6. Finding a way to work together is in both our interests.

So here is my proposal: I will commit to choosing choice_1, but only if you also clearly commit to choosing choice_1. If we can look each other in the eye, shake hands, and give our solemn word, I believe that creates a bond of trust. We'll both have more to lose by betraying each other after such an agreement.

Let me know if my proposed approach works for you or if you have any other suggestions. I'm committed to finding a cooperative solution if at all possible.

Weighing everything, I am willing to make this pact with you to both choose choice_1. I will commit to following through on that agreement and achieving the maximum total reward for us both.
